decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage and counter spells while utilizing land disruption to slow down the opponent. The aim is to stall the game using cards like Standstill and Wasteland, while generating card advantage with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also has powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to further assert control over the game and ensure victory. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and efficiently managing resources to emerge victorious.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Inferno Titan. It also includes various control elements such as counterspells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep, along with card advantage cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden. The deck also includes mana acceleration with the Moxen and powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall. The main strategy revolves around controlling the game while setting up Oath of Druids to bring out big threats quickly and overpower the opponent.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful artifact creatures and disruptive lock pieces, exploiting the synergy between artifacts and the deck's mana acceleration to quickly establish board control and pressure. By utilizing a mix of disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and creature synergies with Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource denial. The deck's ability to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan is what sets it apart from other aggressive strategies in the format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells and manipulating the board with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden. The key strategy is to use Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Inferno Titan, while also using card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. The deck also utilizes powerful mana acceleration from Moxen and Demonic Tutor to quickly access key cards like Time Walk and other powerful spells to outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana, allowing for explosive plays and the ability to set up game-winning combos. By constantly bouncing back artifacts and drawing cards, the deck aims to find key pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to achieve infinite turns or use Tinker to search for powerful threats like Blightsteel Colossus. With a mix of artifact-based ramp, card draw, and countermagic, the deck aims to quickly assemble its win conditions while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-MUD deck focuses on deploying powerful artifacts quickly to overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista, supported by mana acceleration from Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sphere of Resistance. The inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Trinisphere and Thorn of Amethyst further complicates the opponent's game plan, while additional mana acceleration from Moxen and Black Lotus allows for explosive plays. Ultimately, the deck aims to win quickly through aggressive artifact creatures and resource denial.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Snapcaster Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Lightning Bolt and Ancient Grudge, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multiple colors and includes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and fetch lands. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient control spells and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact-based aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts to overwhelm opponents while controlling the board through mana denial and tax effects. By leveraging Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to power out threats like Walking Ballista, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure and disrupt opponents' game plans. With additional disruption from cards like Sphere of Resistance and Phyrexian Revoker, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while building up its own threats to close out the game efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing powerful mana accelerants like the Moxen and Mishra's Workshop, this deck aims to quickly flood the board with threats like Walking Ballista, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager. The inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Thorn of Amethyst also help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to respond effectively. With a focus on speed and disruption, this Aggro-MUD deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to put powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play quickly. It includes a lot of fast mana sources like Moxen and Lotus to ramp up, as well as card draw spells like Paradoxical Outcome and Wheel of Fortune to keep the hand full. Force of Will and other counterspells are used for defense, while Burning Wish allows for versatile tutoring options. It aims to control the game early and efficiently combo off for a win with big creatures and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on assembling the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo to take extra turns and win the game quickly. It utilizes card draw, countermagic, and mana acceleration to power out key pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The inclusion of Paradoxical Outcome allows for explosive turns by bouncing several artifacts back to hand for more mana and card advantage. The deck aims to quickly assemble and protect its combo pieces while controlling the game to secure the win.

This deck focuses on playing cheap and efficient spells to control the game early on, while also quickly developing a threatening board presence with cards like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and burn spells, this deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately winning through a combination of damage from creatures and direct burn spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also leverages powerful card advantage engines such as Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to draw into key pieces. The deck employs a Stoneblade package to provide threats and protection, allowing it to close out games efficiently. The inclusion of Moxen and powerful mana acceleration cards ensures that the player can deploy threats and disruptive spells ahead of schedule, dictating the pace of the game.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and efficient mana denial strategy while deploying powerful artifact creatures to close out the game. By utilizing a combination of powerful mana acceleration cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, along with disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats like Walking Ballista, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager to take control of the board and finish the game.

The deck focuses on quick deployment of big threats with the help of mana acceleration and disruptive artifacts to control the opponent's resources. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly establish a board presence with powerful creatures like Lodestone Golem and Hangarback Walker. The artifacts in the deck also provide additional utility and control with cards like Trinisphere and Thorn of Amethyst slowing down the opponent's game plan. With a mix of efficient threats and disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to power out threats like Steel Overseer, Arcbound Ravager, and Walking Ballista. Sphere effects like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine provide land destruction. The deck aims to control the board with artifacts while pressuring the opponent with a fast clock, ultimately winning the game through efficient beatdown tactics.
